= Dependencies =

Here is a basic set of dependencies that you will need to install before you can install NautilusSvn.  The actual package names are different for each distribution.  For now, NautilusSvn is Linux only, because we rely on the pyinotify module, which uses inotify, a linux kernel feature.  In the future, we hope to use GIO to watch for file changes.

|| *Program* || *Description* ||
|| [http://svn.gnome.org/viewvc/nautilus-python/ nautilus-python] || Nautilus extension python bindings ||
|| [http://www.voidspace.org.uk/python/configobj.html configobj] || Python configuration module ||
|| [http://pyinotify.sourceforge.net/ pyinotify] || Python bindings for monitoring filesystems changes ||
|| [http://www.pygtk.org/ pygtk] || GTK+ python bindings ||
|| [http://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/Software/DBusBindings python-dbus] || Dbus python bindings ||
|| [http://pysvn.tigris.org/ pysvn] || Subversion python bindings ||
|| [http://subversion.tigris.org/ subversion] || Subversion, duh! ||
|| [http://meld.sourceforge.net/ meld] || A GTK+ diff tool ||

= Distro-specific instructions =

== Ubuntu 8.10 ==

1. Install the following packages through your package manager.
{{{
sudo apt-get install python-nautilus python-configobj python-pyinotify python-gtk2 python-glade2 python-dbus python-svn subversion meld
}}}

2. [http://code.google.com/p/nautilussvn/wiki/ManualInstallation Install the Extension]

== OpenSUSE 11.1 ==

1. In Yast -> Software Repositories.  Add the GNOME:STABLE and GNOME:Community repositories.

2. Install packages:
{{{
zypper install python-nautilus dbus-1-python dbus-1-python-devel python-gtk python-gtk-devel python-pysvn gcc subversion meld
}}}

3. Get python-pyinotify http://pyinotify.sourceforge.net/
    # Must get v0.7.1, as 0.8.x doesn't work atm
    # Uncompress the bz2 file and in the pyinotify folder type: sudo python setup.py install

4. Get python-configobj at http://www.voidspace.org.uk/python/configobj.html#files
    * Copy configobj.py to /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/

5. Edit the file /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pysvn/__init__.py
    There is a place where it says:
{{{
elif maj_min == (2,5):
    ....  
}}}      
    Add another elif block, like this...
{{{     
elif maj_min == (2,6):
    import _pysvn_2_6
    _pysvn = _pysvn_2_6
}}}

6. [http://code.google.com/p/nautilussvn/wiki/ManualInstallation Install the Extension]

== Fedora 10 ==

1. Install Packages:
{{{
yum install nautilus-python dbus-python pysvn python-configobj gnome-python2-devel subversion meld gcc
}}}

2. Get python-pyinotify http://pyinotify.sourceforge.net/
  # Must get v0.7.1, as 0.8.x doesn't work atm
  # Can get a Fedora 9 RPM from here: http://rpmfind.net/linux/rpm2html/search.php?query=python-inotify

  Note: I couldn't get the bz2 file from the pyinotify site to install, but the Fedora 9 0.7.1 RPMs linked to above will install and work for F10.

3. [http://code.google.com/p/nautilussvn/wiki/ManualInstallation Install the Extension]

== CentOS 5.2 ==

*Note: Does not yet work due to issues with dbus-python.*

1. Add the RPMForge Repositories.  Instructions are at http://wiki.centos.org/AdditionalResources/Repositories/RPMForge

2. Install Packages:
{{{
yum install pygtk2 dbus-python subversion subversion-devel gcc gcc-c++ neon-devel python-devel pygtk2-devel eel2 eel2-devel python-configobj nautilus-devel meld
}}}

3. Download nautilus-python bindings at http://ftp.acc.umu.se/pub/GNOME/sources/nautilus-python
 * Make sure you get v0.5.0, NOT v0.5.1
 * Build/install with: su -c './configure ; make ; make install'

4. Get python-pyinotify at http://pyinotify.sourceforge.net/
 * Don't install the version in rpmforge.  It's too old.
 * Must get v0.7.1, as 0.8.x doesn't work atm
 * Uncompress the bz2 file and in the pyinotify folder type: su -c 'python setup.py install'

5. Download and build the pysvn extension source kit.
 * http://pysvn.tigris.org/project_downloads.html
 * Uncompress the pysvn tar.gz file then run the following commands:
{{{
cd Source
python setup.py configure
make
mkdir /usr/lib/python2.4/site-packages/pysvn
cp pysvn/__init__.py /usr/lib/python2.4/site-packages/pysvn
cp pysvn/_pysvn_2_4.so /usr/lib/python2.4/site-packages/pysvn
}}}

6. [http://code.google.com/p/nautilussvn/wiki/ManualInstallation Install the Extension]
